result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela M Pechanach

records.addlTxt:
10:54 AM Defendant Angela M Pechanach in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Angela M Pechanach.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has received pictures received from the State, and submitted DPA application, but has not received anything back from the State. Defense requests plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets. 

Court reviews WCS letter.  
Defense gives explanation re: missed appointments. 
State requests that the court admonish the Defendant re: missed appointments. 
Court admonishes Defendant re: WCS compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10/17/2022 received and filed.

10:49 AM Defendant Angela M Pechanach in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Angela M Pechanach.  Attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has received an initial pre-trial offer for the State. Defense will be submitting a DPA application. Defense is still awaiting some discovery and requests a date in 30 days. 
Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

9:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Angela M Pechanach appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Angela Wang for Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Angela M Pechanach. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Request to appear via zoom
**Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 08-15-2022. "Defendant may appear by Zoom video for this hearing only."
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty. Nimmer.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS. Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS within two business days.

09:16 AM Defendant Angela M Pechanach in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
